item.title: XTEA Database
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Davidi2:

Nah it’s not that, I’m racist against vBulliten. The normal website looks fine.

Alright? Well, I’ll edit this post when I finish.

Well learned something about stacks today.

http://keys.evel.us

Alright it’s fixed. You can now leave your files for the appropriate revisions by and whenever we get the server hosted then we will be rolling through requests. The speed is a bit slow but it can handle quite a bit of requests. (Maximum I’ve tested is about 60,000 and it was shoveling them out at the same rate no problem).

As for showing keys, that should be fixed tomorrow.

~780 entries for 614 as of right now.

Read full topic

item.description:

Davidi2:

If tl;dr means “Terrible layout[vBul :X]; didn’t register”, then yes!

tl;dr Alright…what are you trying to say? If I could have monkeys that worked 24/7 then the site would be finished by now but my graphic artist and web developers have lives. As by evidence by the rest of the site, we will finish the theme. There are just a ton of priorities to juggle when you are trying to start your own community and my only graphic designer is split between many tasks right now.

item.title: XTEA Database
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:17, topic:427295”]I’m pretty sure he was just taking a screenshot of the real RS map and edited it in paint as an example…

Also, still no keys?

I doubt you guys have more than I do for my 508, but it’d be nice to make sure :)[/quote]

Ex of what I am saying:

Gotcha Ems.

Web developers are out celebrating and I restructured the tables so that each table has only its own keys. So unless one of them comes back soon it’s going to stay ‘keyless’. As for the 508 map data I have, I’m not sure how many entries there are but if you do try and upload anything please be aware of these announcements I made on our forums:

The beta version of the server is finished and finally tests are going underway. The server will be up tomorrow and if you are willing to give me suggestions as to what cache formats you would like to see then I can add them. As for encoding we only support the following format:

[WORD : Region Hash][DWORD 0…3 : KEYS]

The future update to the server will include where it will be possible to upload a Zipped file with contents being as follows:

tl;dr?

David is lazy, and you have to follow this format to upload files for now: [WORD : Region Hash][DWORD 0…3 : KEYS]

Also note that the amount of keys that the server processes per hour is very slow because of all the synchronization checks I have in place. So we might have to open multiple servers or I will have to rewrite the systems to support faster processing.

Sort Size: 3
Sort Size: 4
Sort Size: 7
Sort Size: 8
Sort Size: 11
Sort Size: 12
Sort Size: 15
Sort Size: 16
Sort Size: 19

~1 second cycles.

Read full topic

item.title: XTEA Database
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Pure Slay, post:15, topic:427295”]You obviously need a bump so you can post again. Also, you should make a plugin for viewing what keys you have on a visual print out of the runescape map. I know that Vincent, Emperor, and Alex have all created Java applications to view what keys have been found and are valid, compared to those that aren’t.

Ex of what I am saying:

2vn4aid.jpg649×539

Obviously black areas are areas with no valid keys for that revision.[/quote]

That just looks like the RS map sprite in the cache with giant black splotches on it. Even the zoom in sprites and over view sprite looks like an exact replica of the RS map :|, definitely not what I am going to do. As for what I plan to do with the visual piece, it’s very uncertain. I would rather have a web safe sort of visual representation because people will respond more positively to it. I will most likely make some ‘image dump’ scripts that take the height map just for now and makes an image. I will then talk to my web developers about what they can do with the images .

Tl;dr, I’m trying to stay away from java applets.

Read full topic

item.title: XTEA Database
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:12, topic:427295”]Tell your website developers to stop using vBulliten… please…

Also, why can I not see the keys? Do you need to log in or something?[/quote]

I dropped the keys database while I upgrade the server so that people can actually upload their own files without it crashing from concurrency issues. I also have to implement a system for people who have ‘.txt’ and zip it so I can correctly format it in the format that we support. It will be up tomorrow and I will add more caches for people to upload once I track them down and run a dump script on them/analyze the FIT table.

Check back tomorrow morning and the beta will be done.

@David

Nothing wrong with real vB. Even though I agree vB isn’t as cool as everyone makes it out to be.

Read full topic

item.title: XTEA Database
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Pure Slay, post:10, topic:427295”][quote author=Wintercanon link=topic=529995.msg3869531#msg3869531 date=1325252056]
Glad to see you got it finalised. Sorry I couldn’t help fully test it today, I’ll be back to work Monday.

http://rushgamer.com/mapdata/
[/quote]If you took the time to actually test ours you’d see that ours is actually a community update-able tool and not just someone’s collective dump of random XTEA keys.

Also note, if your submitted keys don’t immediately show it doesn’t mean they’re invalid. We have systems in place that try to balance the load of incoming submissions to the server so that it doesn’t become overloaded and crash.

I was actually just linking to a bunch of valid mapdata for your database, but oh well. Also, you should have an option to display by like 10/20/50/100 results at a time. Also filtering by revision, region id, ect.

Edit:
You should double check your validation methods.

2cf2i3k.png1067×94
[/quote]

Ignore the multiple entries, its a bug for right now.

Server isn’t up right now because I am fixing some concurrency issues. Also that isn’t a validation issue, that is a MYSQL issue. Since any file marker with ‘0, 0, 0, 0’ is not considered encrypted all it has too pass is if the container parses correctly. Given, if its marked as not encrypted and it really is then it will not pass validation.

 10/20/50/100 results at a time

The server will just publish hourly builds of the lists until we get the interactive map idea solidly finished. The table is just for debugging/proof of concept.

Read full topic
